items.summary: Scientists Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi receive the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry "for the development of metal-organic frameworks", the award-giving body announces.

items.title: Latest Financial news
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Beth Mooney, Alana King save Australia from Women's Cricket World Cup upset loss to Pakistan
items.summary: Beth Mooney's century and a classy unbeaten 51 from Alana King saves Australia from a stunning upset loss to Pakistan at the Cricket World Cup.

items.title: Myanmar's military uses paraglider to bomb festival and anti-junta protest
items.summary: People were gathering for the festival and an anti-junta demonstration when bombs killed at least 20 people and injured dozens more.

items.title: Labor backbencher calls for action to stop countries onselling Australian gas
items.summary: Ed Husic calls for stronger action to prevent foreign countries that buy Australian gas from onselling it to other countries.

items.title: Callum Cook pleads not guilty to Christmas Day murder of Russell Klein in Millmerran
items.summary: A barrister for the accused tells a Queensland court Callum Cook acted in self-defence during an incident that left a 55-year-old father dead in his front yard.

items.title: Fatal shooting of man in Sydney's north-west a 'brazen' targeted attack, police say
items.summary: A man was found with gunshot wounds on a street in Riverstone, in Sydney's north-west. A short time later two burnt-out cars were discovered nearby.

items.title: Mates channel MacGyver in rescue of galah trapped in power pole in WA's north
items.summary: A lifetime sailor says his experience problem-solving with limited resources helped figure out how to rescue a galah trapped in an 8-metre-tall power pole.

items.title: Free the galah
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: British man jailed in New York over $US99 million fine wine fraud scheme
items.summary: The scheme ran from June 2017 to February 2019, and collapsed when interest payments stopped.

items.title: With pressure from China to last, more metals facilities could put their hands up for a bailout
items.summary: The bailout of another metals facility — this time in Queensland — is unlikely to be the last, with pressures on the sector driven by China to keep up for years.

items.title: Murder trial begins for man accused of killing and burning David Collisson near Mudgee
items.summary: David Collisson's remains were found near Mudgee in October 2023. It is believed he was shot dead a month earlier.

items.title: Jordan Spencer jailed for 13 years for setting woman alight
items.summary: A 34-year-old Shepparton woman has been jailed for 13 years after dousing another woman with petrol and setting her on fire during a dispute over an e-scooter.

items.title: Grieving Canberra dog owner warns of deadly blue-green algae but testing shows no increased risk
items.summary: Toxic algae is sometimes detected in Canberra's waterways, where a dog died after swimming.

items.title: Audit reveals widespread public housing electrical issues in wake of three-year-old's tragic death
items.summary: The death of a three-year-old boy in an Alice Springs house fire has led to an electrical audit of Northern Territory public housing, which uncovered widespread issues affecting hundreds of homes, an inquest has heard.

items.title: Algal bloom chief asked about 'disaster' declaration as inquiry told of thousands of marine deaths
items.summary: The SA government has never formally requested that the Commonwealth declare the algal bloom a "national disaster", a senior bureaucrat has told a parliamentary inquiry — despite a state minister "advocating" for such a response three months ago.

items.title: Australia's parliament is likely to grow for the first time in 40 years
items.summary: Australia's parliament is likely to get larger as the government canvasses possibilities for expanding the number of MPs and introducing fixed or four-year terms.

items.title: City of Melbourne set to vote on security camera overhaul, surveillance powers for staff
items.summary: The City of Melbourne is set to vote on a new plan that would see more privately owned CCTV cameras feeding into the city's security network and staff able to access the footage to investigate local law breaches.

items.title: Rex flight evacuated after engine catches fire at Adelaide Airport
items.summary: Passengers have praised the actions of the pilot and cabin crew after a Rex aircraft was evacuated at Adelaide Airport this morning following a fire emergency.

items.title: Three charged with murder and torture of Brisbane man Andrew Burow
items.summary: Police will allege Andrew Burow endured a three to four-day ordeal which began after meeting with the accused in August.

items.title: Jon Stevens releases new album Shimmer, announces tour on 64th birthday
items.summary: From teen idol to rock great, Jon Stevens has fronted legendary bands Noiseworks and INXS. He has chosen his 64th birthday to release a new album and announce a tour.

items.title: Do dishwashers release microplastics when you wash plastic containers and kitchenware?
items.summary: If you're worried about microplastics, is it safe to wash plastic containers and other utensils in the dishwasher, given the use of heat and detergents? We asked two experts.

items.title: Stephen Miller has said Donald Trump has plenary authority but what does that actually mean?
items.summary: A Trump administration official faces criticism after allegedly claiming US President Donald Trump has "plenary authority" while on a live interview with CNN.

items.title: Strava is suing Garmin for patent infringement. Here's what we know
items.summary: Fitness app Strava and sports watchmaker Garmin usually go hand-in-hand, but the two fitness tech leaders are now in competition in a US lawsuit.

items.title: Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium debate weighs 'expert' advice
items.summary: Tasmania's minister responsible for the proposed $1.13 billion Macquarie Point stadium, Eric Abetz, says there are many "expert" views, but ultimately the government will decide.

items.title: Ex-Collingwood player Shannon Cox jailed for killing women in Brand Hwy car crash
items.summary: Former Collingwood player Shannon Cox, who had meth in his system when his car smashed into a hatchback, killing two elderly women, is jailed for manslaughter.

items.title: Scramble to protect Kangaroo Island bee colony, one of the world's unique colonies, from varroa mite
items.summary: A deadly parasite that has laid waste to bee colonies throughout Australia has so far not made it to Kangaroo Island, home to the world's oldest bee sanctuary.

items.title: Trade restrictions for Philippines banana imports to be reviewed by federal government
items.summary: The federal government will review its quarantine rules after a formal request by the Philippines to import its bananas, but the industry is pushing back.

items.title: Qantas says 'legal protections in place' as cyber hacking group threatens to release personal data
items.summary: Qantas says it is continuing to support customers as a hacking group threatens to release personal data from around 40 companies to the dark web.

items.title: AFLW Carlton star Darcy Vescio says 'punching down' on Mad Monday must end
items.summary: Inaugural Carlton AFLW star Darcy Vescio has urged players to be more conscious of their role-model status when dressing up for end-of-season celebrations.

items.title: Melbourne man sentenced over medical cannabis company Cann Group insider trading case
items.summary: A Melbourne man found guilty of insider trading during a $20 million capital raise by a medicinal cannabis company has been ordered to pay more than $225,000.

items.title: Former clinical director Hannah Lake leads Hobart Clinic rescue bid
items.summary: The former clinical director of the Hobart Clinic, psychiatrist Dr Hannah Lake, is part of a last-minute push for the institution to be given a reprieve before it closes its doors at the end of next week.

items.title: City of Stirling terminates football club's lease after player's alleged explicit Stephen Hawking costume
items.summary: A Perth football club faces deregistration and has been expelled from their club rooms after a player reportedly attended a post-season party dressed as Stephen Hawking, allegedly with explicit images involving himself as a child attached.

items.title: Thousands of flights disrupted as US government shutdown enters its second week
items.summary: The US government shutdown is entering its second week and the impacts are starting to play out, with thousands of flights disrupted across the country.

items.title: Abuse survivor Dion Barber 'mortified' by state's challenge of $2.85m compensation payout
items.summary: An appeal against a $2.85 million compensation payout to a man who suffered child sexual abuse while in state care should be abandoned, a prominent Perth lawyer and the state opposition says.

items.title: Optus email mishap left department in dark about triple-0 outage, even after Anika Wells' office told
items.summary: The telco operator sent two emails about its outage, which understated its extent, to a departmental email address that had been changed a week earlier.

items.title: Dolly Parton's sister speaks out over singer's health concerns
items.summary: Dolly Parton's sister has asked fans to pray for the country music singer's health just one week after the star delayed several concerts in Las Vegas.

items.title: Male whales race in pursuit of female in east coast migration

items.title: Male humpback whales race in pursuit of female during east coast migration
items.summary: A drone photographer captures vision of a tightly packed pod of 11 humpback whales heading south in a race to mate off the NSW mid-north coast.

items.title: High Court backs use of encrypted app to monitor crime figures after challenge by bikies
items.summary: The High Court has ruled on the use of information gathered through the AN0M app, which was developed by the Australian Federal Police for surveillance.

items.title: Geelong Cats fined by AFL over third-party arrangements
items.summary: The AFL fines Geelong $77,500 for failing to disclose third-party agreements with players over a six-year period.

items.title: More than 500 hikers reportedly rescued after being stranded on Mount Everest
items.summary: Hundreds of trekkers, villagers and support staff have safely reached the Tibetan town of Qudang, according to Chinese state media.

items.title: Sam Kerr to play for Matildas for the first time in two years
items.summary: Sam Kerr's two year absence from the Matildas is almost over, she's set to feature in friendlies later this month, while Mary Fowler is recovering well from her own ACL injury.

items.title: Last night's harvest moon made for stunning photos. When is the next supermoon?
items.summary: Stargazers from around the world have captured the luminous glow of October's supermoon.

items.title: Broken Hill nurse to represent Australia at Ironman World Championship — Women
items.summary: Broken Hill nurse Bella Kolinac, 23, will represent Australia at the Ironman World Championship — Women in Kona, Hawaii.

items.title: Glencore refinery sites stay open with taxpayer funds
items.summary: The last Australian copper smelter processing third-party product will stay open after its owner accepted a support package.

items.title: WA's Bibbulmun Track running record broken twice in one week
items.summary: Two men have smashed the record for completing one of the world's longest walking tracks in the fastest time, within days of each other.

items.title: Single farmers in Western Australia ditch dating apps for something face to face
items.summary: When the dating app radius won't reach the edge of your property, and you're harvesting grain from sun-up til sundown, how do you find a partner?

items.title: More families raising children with cystic fibrosis staying in the bush
items.summary: Two mums in rural Queensland have spoken about why they choose to live more than 1,000 kilometres from the Queensland Children's Hospital.

items.title: WA iron ore mining shows no signs of slowing despite price drop concerns
items.summary: Australia's two biggest iron ore miners continue to expand their operations in WA's Pilbara, despite warnings of waning demand.

items.title: Arsenal lose 2-1 to Lyon at Women's Champions League as trio of Matildas feature
items.summary: Arsenal goes down 2-1 to Lyon in the Women's Champion League as three Matildas stars make an appearance at Meadow Park.

items.title: Pam Bondi accused of using justice system to target Donald Trump's opponents
items.summary: US Attorney-General Pam Bondi has faced heated questioning from senators over claims she's transforming the justice department into a "shield for the president and his political allies".

items.title: Australians are reading less than ever before. Here's how to read more books
items.summary: Research shows Australians are reading fewer books than ever before. One writer shares her advice on how to make reading a daily habit.

items.title: Neighbour of Kotoni Staggs pays tribute to Broncos star after supporting family through husband's death
items.summary: The neighbour of Kotoni Staggs pays tribute to the Broncos star for helping her through a devastating family death.

items.title: Taylor Swift wears Adelaide label Paolo Sebastian in The Fate of Ophelia music video
items.summary: Founder and designer Paul Vasileff says he's grateful to have his Adelaide-made couture dress on the world stage with pop superstar Taylor Swift wearing it in the new The Fate of Ophelia music video.

items.title: Australian merino wool future positive after surging price restores grower confidence
items.summary: Amid a run of price rises at Australian wool auctions, the next generation of growers say global demand and fresh confidence could mark a turning point for the fibre.

items.title: AFL trade period, day three recap: Brisbane Lions land Oscar Allen, as Sam Flanders, Judd McVee and Brandon Starcevich find new homes
items.summary: Oscar Allen's move to Brisbane is official as West Coast finds out what compensation it will receive for losing its captain. Here's how day three of the AFL trade period panned out.

items.title: Players concerned over Shanghai heat as Novak Djokovic collapses on court
items.summary: Holger Rune says "there is always a limit" as soaring temperatures and humidity in Shanghai and Wuhan tennis events cause player distress.

items.title: Surge in shark-tracking app downloads following fatal Sydney attack
items.summary: There has been a surge in downloads of the SharkSmart app following the fatal attack of a Northern Beaches surfer — in a sign the incident has left some nervous to get back into the water.

items.title: Australian dollar jumps to 10-month high against yen, ASX slips as gold price hits new record — as it happened
items.summary: The ASX 200 closes slightly down as gold maintains record highs. The Australian dollar surges against the Japanese yen on speculation its central bank will delay lifting interest rates. Look back on all the day's business and finance news.

items.title: As WA government looks set to bring Serie A game involving AC Milan to Perth, some football fans are not happy
items.summary: Italian heavyweights AC Milan look set to play a match, for actual Serie A points, in Perth. What will the state government pay to lure them here, and why are some football supporters unhappy?

items.title: Saltwater crocodile found with mouth zip-tied shut in Adelaide River, sparking calls for stronger penalties
items.summary: The discovery of a saltwater crocodile with its mouth bound shut by zip ties in a Darwin river has sparked outrage, with animal rights advocates calling for stronger wildlife protections.

items.title: Regulator investigating WA fire that burnt 11,000ha and left residents homeless
items.summary: Residents who lost their homes in a blaze that ripped through WA's southern wheatbelt in January may have to wait more than two years to seek compensation.

items.title: US Senate committee questions Trump's Pentagon nominee John Noh over AUKUS review
items.summary: The AUKUS submarine pact may need "commonsense" action from both Australia and the US to make it more "sustainable", according to Donald Trump's nominee to oversee US defence strategy in the Indo-Pacific.

items.title: NSW Police intercept alleged 'kill team' near daycare centre in Revesby
items.summary: Police say tactical officers foiled an alleged planned hit near a daycare centre in Revesby in Sydney's south-west on Tuesday afternoon.

items.title: Calls for national gambling watchdog grow amid NT conflict allegations
items.summary: The NT government is standing by its de-facto regulation of Australia’s $50 billion online gambling industry, despite allegations that it is too closely linked to the sector.

items.title: Gold price hits record high, topping $US4,000 an ounce for first time, amid US shutdown and lower interest rates
items.summary: The price of gold has hit another record and is set to become Australia's second most valuable resource export after iron ore.

items.title: Born as the first bombs fell, two-year-old Mohammad has known nothing but war
items.summary: Children in Gaza are experiencing grief, loss, displacement, and starvation. For some, this is all they know or remember.
